intro: Cassipourea elliptica var. alba, commonly known as the white-flowered cassipourea, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its elliptical leaves and white flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in horticulture for its attractive foliage and floral display.
